## Environment Setup
```{r}

library(tidyverse)
library(plotly)
library(seasonal)
library(esquisse)
library(corrplot)
```

# Create a home directory variable
```{r}
home <- 'C:/Users/leandroc/Documents/curso_R/project_data_science__with_r/'

```
# Load the file us_change and 
```{r}
# Concatenation for the file path
file_path = paste(home, "us_change.rda", sep = "")
load(file_path)

```

# Create a new tibble with cleaned names:
```{r}
raw_data <- tibble::as_tibble(us_change)
raw_data <- janitor::clean_names(raw_data)

```

# Converte all the variables in index number: 
```{r}
# To index it is using the 1Â° quarter of 2000 at the index 121
absolute <- 121
indexed_data <- raw_data


for(i in 1:length(indexed_data$consumption)){
  indexed_data$consumption[i] <- (indexed_data$consumption[i] / raw_data$consumption[absolute]) * 100
}

for(i in 1:length(indexed_data$income)){
  indexed_data$income[i] <- (indexed_data$income[i] / raw_data$income[absolute]) * 100
}

for(i in 1:length(indexed_data$production)){
  indexed_data$production[i] <- (indexed_data$production[i] / raw_data$production[absolute]) * 100
}

for(i in 1:length(indexed_data$savings)){
  indexed_data$savings[i] <- (indexed_data$savings[i] / raw_data$savings[absolute]) * 100
}

for(i in 1:length(indexed_data$unemployment)){
  indexed_data$unemployment[i] <- (indexed_data$unemployment[i] / raw_data$unemployment[absolute]) * 100
}

```
